main event: Several observers reported seeing a cigar-shaped object with red lights at the extremities over Mount Hood, Oregon, on November 2, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as being 6-8 times as long as it was wide and displaying red lights at both ends and a bright center light,Several observers believed the object to be Venus,The object drifted North and South at different altitudes according to observers from Oakridge and Government Camp,The sighting was classified with possible explanations ranging from a balloon to astronomical phenomena,The report included testimonies from state patrol officers and local observers.
witness description: observers from Government Camp, Oakridge, and Eugene, Oregon, including state patrol officers
